demo1.web

Class ExceptionHandlingController

  • java.lang.Object
    • demo1.web.ExceptionHandlingController

  • @Controller
 @RequestMapping(value="/local")
public class ExceptionHandlingController
extends java.lang.Object
    A controller whose request-handler methods deliberately throw exceptions to demonstrate the points discussed in the Blog.

    Contains its own @ExceptionHandler methods to handle (most of) the exceptions it raises.

    Author:
    Paul Chapman

java.lang.String home2()

        Returns:

      • throwOrderNotFoundException

        @RequestMapping(value="/orderNotFound")
java.lang.String throwOrderNotFoundException()
        No handler is needed for this exception since it is annotated with @ResponseStatus.
        Returns:
        Nothing - it always throws the exception.
        Throws:
        OrderNotFoundException - Always thrown.

      • throwDataIntegrityViolationException

        @RequestMapping(value="/dataIntegrityViolation")
java.lang.String throwDataIntegrityViolationException()
                                                                                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Throws an unannotated DataIntegrityViolationException. Must be caught by an exception handler.
        Returns:
        Nothing - it always throws the exception.
        Throws:
        DataIntegrityViolationException - Always thrown.
        java.sql.SQLException

      • throwDatabaseException1

        @RequestMapping(value="/databaseError1")
java.lang.String throwDatabaseException1()
                                                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Simulates a database exception by always throwing SQLException. Must be caught by an exception handler.
        Returns:
        Nothing - it always throws the exception.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - Always thrown.

        @RequestMapping(value="/invalidCreditCard")
java.lang.String throwInvalidCreditCard()
                                                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Simulates an illegal credit-card exception by always throwing InvalidCreditCardException. Handled by SimpleMappingExceptionResolver.

        Nothing - it always throws the exception.
        Throws:
        InvalidCreditCardException - Always thrown.

        Throws:
        DatabaseException - Always thrown.
        java.lang.Exception

      • throwCustomException

        @RequestMapping(value="/supportInfoException")
java.lang.String throwCustomException()
                                                                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Always throws a SupportInfoException. Must be caught by an exception handler.
        Returns:
        Nothing - it always throws the exception.
        Throws:
        SupportInfoException - Always thrown.
        java.lang.Exception

      • throwUnhandledException

        @RequestMapping(value="/unhandledException")
java.lang.String throwUnhandledException()
                                                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Simulates a database exception by always throwing UnhandledException. Must be caught by an exception handler.
        Returns:
        Nothing - it always throws the exception.
        Throws:
        UnhandledException - Always thrown.
        java.lang.Exception

      • conflict

        @ResponseStatus(value=CONFLICT,
                reason="Data integrity violation")
 @ExceptionHandler(value=DataIntegrityViolationException.class)
public void conflict()
        Convert a predefined exception to an HTTP Status code

      • databaseError

        @ExceptionHandler(value={java.sql.SQLException.class,DataAccessException.class})
public java.lang.String databaseError(java.lang.Exception exception)
        Convert a predefined exception to an HTTP Status code and specify the name of a specific view that will be used to display the error.
        Returns:
        Exception view.

      • handleError

        @ExceptionHandler(value=SupportInfoException.class)
public org.springframework.web.servlet.ModelAndView handleError(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                                                                                                                    java.lang.Exception exception)
                                                                                                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Demonstrates how to take total control - setup a model, add useful information and return the "support" view name. This method explicitly creates and returns
        Parameters:
        req - Current HTTP request.
        exception - The exception thrown - always SupportInfoException.
        Returns:
        The model and view used by the DispatcherServlet to generate output.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
